text: Brooks House The William P. Brooks House, also known as Brooks Hall, is a dormitory in Amherst, Massachusetts that is built in the georgian revival style with art deco accents. It is named after former professor and president List_of_chancellors_of_the_University_of_Massachusetts_Amherst of Massachusetts Agricultural College, William P. Brooks. It is part of the Central Residential Area at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. It was designed by Louis Ross, who designed many of the dormitories on campus as well as the Student Union. In addition to his academic and administrative career, Brooks is credited as one of six Founders of Phi Sigma Kappa fraternity in 1873 at Massachusetts Agricultural College. == References == ==External links== *Official website for Brooks Hall *Umass Library entry for Brooks Hall *Brooks Hall Category:University of Massachusetts Amherst residence halls
title: William P. Brooks House
